text: Hi everyone. I’m starting designing a HubSpot (didn’t worked with HubSpot for a while). I’d like to work locally but the issue is that the FTP doesn’t show the same folder structure as in the Design Manager (<https://cl.ly/3g1Z3F2w2834>). I waiting for help from HubSpot support since few days, but maybe someone could help me understanding what’s going wrong…

I don’t personally work locally but I think this is actually normal what you’re seeing. I think the folder structure you see in the finder is more for visual organization than it actually is structure. I think the files are all actually in a pre-determined structure like you see in FTP.

This is probably to do 2 things, make the files be cross compatible with the old design manager and make it easier for HubSpot staff to develop because they know where files are supposed to be.
Actually the folders on the FTP are all empty…
ohhh, yea that’s a different issue
that’s definitely not right
But maybe the FTP work the old way for the old design manager, and thus doesn’t display things if you use the freedom of the new design manager file structure. I don’t know how to test that…

I've run into this, there is an issue with FTP and the new DM. If you aren't using any specific DMII features then you should be able to revert back to DMI and then it should work, otherwise you're left with copy-pasting or maybe there's an API method :confused:

Bluleadz is looking for an in house designer/developer. Obviously HubSpot experience is a HUGE plus. Ideally it would be someone with decent design chops who has worked on a team and can code their own work as well as someone else’s. <https://www.bluleadz.com/careers>
If you are in the Tampa Bay Area and would love to work for a great agency hop on over!
Please refer to me when you apply in your resumè/cover letter.
Yeah, updating FTP to reflect the folder structure of the new Design IDE is in progress
How much do you get for the signing/referral bonus :wink:
<@U22PJPGK0> Thanks. Do you have any idea when the FTP update will ship?
Shhhhh…
Seriously though we are in search of a decent design/dev.  If you know anyone in out area please send them our way.
<@U22PNRAJD> may be able to speak to that
Updating FTP is in active development as I type. Our goal is to have this updated for you all no later then the end of the month but the hope is sooner then that.
That would be great, I’m leaving for few weeks off and so it should be there when I’ll be back :slightly_smiling_face:
Congrats for your amazing website redesign <@U38EZFVFE>! We love it
It is quite a nice looking site…
Hey HubSpotters! Im looking for a way to block traffic by IP is this possible?

```{% set blocked_ips = ['192.168.0.1', '192.168.0.2', 'etc'] %}{% if request.remote_ip in blocked_ips %} {# redirect or javascript or render a password prompt or whatever! #}{% endif %}``` Alternatively… to avoid loss of caching as <@U6GNQ7JBU> has said (and if it’s a known contact) you can use the IP Address contact field (or a custom field that holds a boolean for if they’re blocked or not
if you need ranges, you’ll have to match the first 3 sections, then split out the last number and compare against upper / lower bounds
Why do you need to block by IP?
In the above example, you lose cacheability of the page
<@U6GNQ7JBU> swooping in to decry any use of the {{request}} object
Seriously... Are you guys using react router or something for the page transitions? so clean.
nope… :wink:
Just a simple css animation.
damn, well done, looks really good
there is just a bit of js to initiate the css animations
<https://gist.github.com/stefenphelps/ecc33d093a7970c0cce3e7647beae670>
simple, I like it. thanks dude!

it would be better to redirect to a page that is just an image of liam neeson staring at you and two buttons that read: "I'm Sorry" and "I'm Really Sorry" both buttons just lead you to this youtube video: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ifmRgQX82O4>

Hello! I'm surfacing an issue where I am try to render 2 form modules on a page, I believe it was working at one point in time. What is happening is the first form is generated and the second one renders the container, but the form is missing. Has anyone run into a similar issue?


_example form modules_ 

```
  {% form
	form_to_use="{{ module.keep_learning_form.form_id }}"
	response_response_type="{{ module.keep_learning_form.response_type }}"
	response_message="{{ module.keep_learning_form.message }}"
	response_redirect_id="{{ module.keep_learning_form.redirect_id }}"
	response_redirect_url="{{module.keep_learning_form.redirect_url}}"
	gotowebinar_webinar_key="{{ module.module.keep_learning_form.gotowebinar_webinar_key }"
%}


{% form
	form_to_use="{{ module.request_pricing_form.form_id }}"
	response_response_type="{{ module.request_pricing_form.response_type }}"
	response_message="{{ module.request_pricing_form.message }}"
	response_redirect_id="{{ module.request_pricing_form.redirect_id }}"
	response_redirect_url="{{module.request_pricing_form.redirect_url}}"
	gotowebinar_webinar_key="{{ module.module.request_pricing_form.gotowebinar_webinar_key }"
%}  
      

```
have you tried adding a name to the module like `[% form "form1"...%}`
<@U22PJPGK0> thank you, works like a charm!
Hi all, I’m looking to connect with developers comfortable with the HubSpot platform for a few of our clients.  Our company is <http://www.oshinstudio.com>
I was informed that I shouldn’t ping the whole channel, but would love to connect with solid front end devs comfortable working with HubSpot
<@UBMHW9JCR> are you looking for agency support or actual devs?

EIther or depending on the rate.  We’re an agency ourselves, but looking to connect with resources comfortable deving on the platform.  Our team is booked for the next 16 weeks on another project and i’m trying to find solid front end folks

Got an interesting problem

I have _page A_ with _form A_ on it. After submitting _page A_ a user is added to a list based on certain criteria.

The user lands on _page B_ which if the person is not in the list, just shows some text. If they ARE in the list, it shows _form B_

Problem is. The workflow to tag the person as added to the list takes awhile and the user can land on _page B_ before they get added, causing them to not see _form B_

Anyone got any solutions to this?

the only idea we have is delaying the load of the page - and that sucks.
Never done this myself, but maybe you could set your own custom cookie via JS, then use JS to add / remove or show / hide the form after the page loads?
yea, kinda hoping to avoid the cookie route, but it may be the only safe way.
Hey <@U7SL518D6> you can send them to a "redirect page" that has an html redirect to your desired page that allows for the workflow to catch up
yea we were just discussing that possibility, but we still can’t garuntee the wait was long enough

I think we’re going to use the javascript API to on form submit, check the user’s answers in the form, send the user to one of two different pages instead of using smart content.

It’s the only truly reliable solution we can think of.
<@U7SL518D6> What if you set a contact property.
does that come through fast enough though?
That is super quick. So if they fill out the first form the contact property is set.
I have used it before.
seems to work well.
Maybe as a hidden field in the form
I think that is how we ended up using it.
with a hidden field.
That way it is already in the db when the next page loads.
hmmm
think I still have to use JS to grab form submission values
You can pass them into the url.

still requires JS lol. 

I appreciate the walking through this issue with me guys, gonna think on it tonight implement tomorrow
lol.. I have been there
